oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Department of Energy Photograph Collection
Sale of first house to private citizen
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two men sitting at a desk. One man is handing the other a piece of paper.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Housing; Privatization
Landay, N. N.; Lobetti, George Edward
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: See The Oak Ridger of September 12, 1956, page 3. This article states that the first house sold was the house at 151 Oak Ridge Turnpike to Mr. and Mrs. Luther Brannon. This photo may refer to the sale of the house at 122 Euclid Circle. That article also identifies the two men as George Edward Lobetti, HHFA realty officer, on the right, and N. N. Landay.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Physical rights are retained by the institution. Copyright is retained in accordance with U. S. Copyright laws.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Oak Ridge Public Library, 1401 Oak Ridge Trpke, Oak Ridge, TN 37830 reference@oakridgetn.gov
